trial_identification.studytitle: Midodrine for the Treatment of Refractory Hypotension
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Midodrine for the Treatment of Refractory Hypotension in Patients Otherwise Ready for Discharge From the ICU

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Midodrine Treatment: drugs - Placebo
Active Comparator: Midodrine -
Placebo Comparator: Placebo -
Treatment: drugs: Midodrine Patients will be randomized to blinded to 20 mg of midodrine
Treatment: drugs: Placebo Patients will be randomized to blinded placebo control

primaryOutcome.outcome: Time until discontinuation of IV vasopressors - Measured hours from initiation of midodrine until discontinuation of IV vasopressors
primaryOutcome.timepoint: IV vasopressors expected to be discontinued 1 day to 7 days after starting midodrine

secondaryOutcome.outcome: ICU length of stay - Measured number of days from initiation of midodrine until discharge ready from the ICU
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Patients are expected to be discharged from the SICU 5 to 7 days after starting midodrine

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Hospital length of stay - Measured number of days from initiation of midodrine until discharged from hospital
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Patients are expected to be discharged from the hospital 2 to 4 weeks after starting midodrine

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Rates of ICU readmission - Number of patients initiated on midodrine that are readmitted back to ICU after being discharged to floor
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Expected that patients will be followed 1 to 2 weeks after discharge to assess rates of readmission

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Rates of hypertension, bradycardia, and hemodynamically significant tacharrythmias - Measured rates of hypertension (increase in systolic blood pressure to values higher than those set by the primary team or greater than 160 mmg), bradycardia (decrease in heart rate to values lower than those set by the primary team or less than 40 BPM), hemodynamically significant tachyarrythmias (greater than 20 mmhg decrease in systolic blood pressure).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Rates of side effects will be followed while patient is on midodrine which is expected to be 5 to 7 days

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- At least 18 years of age
- Admitted to the SICU
- Requiring IV vasopressors at a rate of less than 100 mcg/min of phenylephrine, or 8 mcg/min of norepinephrine, or 60 mcg/min of metaraminol; and unable to wean for more than 24 hours while still maintaining desired blood pressure goal
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Inadequate tissue oxygenation
- Liver failure
- Renal failure
- Hypovolemic shock or hypotension due to adrenal insufficiency
- Pregnancy
- Severe organic heart disease
- Urinary retention
- Pheochromocytoma
- Thyrotoxicosis
- Midodrine as pre-admission medication
- Any known allergies to midodrine
- Enrollment in another clinical trial

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We hypothesize that midodrine treatment of refractory hypotension in patients otherwise ready for discharge from the ICU shortens duration of receiving IV vasopressors and SICU length of stay without increasing MGH length of stay or putting the patient at risk of being readmitted to an ICU.
